Package com.zanderwohl.chunks.Block

Class BlockLibrary

java.lang.Object
com.zanderwohl.chunks.Block.BlockLibrary
public class BlockLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
An object that manages all the blocks in particular world. It is responsible for assigning block ids to each block. Receives blocks through the addition of a domain. Takes all blocks from the domain.json file and loads their properties by loading the json files of each block. It also manages multiple domains and can find block ids by name and vice-versa.

  • Constructor Summary

    BlockLibrary​(java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<com.zanderwohl.console.Message> toConsole)
    Creates a block library, by default blank except for containing air at id 0.

      public BlockLibrary​(java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<com.zanderwohl.console.Message> toConsole)

  • Method Details

    • addDomain

      public void addDomain​(JSONObject domain)
      Adds a "domain" - a set of blocks and textures that can be added to a world. Each domain has a name, and each block is referenced by the format "domainName:blockName", which is a consistent key for that block. Block ids may change world to world, depending on which domains exist in that world. References to a particular block should ALWAYS be domain:block, as number ids may change.
      Parameters:
      domain - A json object that contains all domain information. See README.

    • addBlock

      public void addBlock​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String domainName)
      Adds a block to the library, and gives it an id. Note that a block cannot belong to two libraries.
      Parameters:
      path - Filename of that block, relative to the root of the "[domain]/blocks/" folder.
      domainName - The name of the domain this block belongs to.

    • load

      public static BlockLibrary load​(java.lang.String saveFile, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<com.zanderwohl.console.Message> toConsole)
      Constructs a BlockLibrary from an existing save file. Needs to be written.
      Parameters:
      saveFile - The save file to load the block library from.
      Returns:
      A block library loaded from the file.

    • getNameById

      public java.lang.String getNameById​(int id)
      Gets a block's name based on its id.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the block in question.
      Returns:
      The name with domain.

    • getIdByName

      public int getIdByName​(java.lang.String domain, java.lang.String name)
      Get the id, given a domain and name.
      Parameters:
      domain - The domain.
      name - The name.
      Returns:
      The id, if it exists, or 0, the id of air if it does not.

    • getBlockColor

      public int getBlockColor​(int id)
      Get the color of the block by id.
      Parameters:
      id - The id.
      Returns:
      The color of the block as an RGB integer.
